segment.source: Replace a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)
segment.target: Replace a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager (Windows 10)

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to replacing a Windows 7 SP1 computer using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to replacing a Windows 7 SP1 computer using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Replace a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager
segment.target: Replace a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: In this topic, you will learn how to replacing a Windows 7 SP1 computer using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: In this topic, you will learn how to replacing a Windows 7 SP1 computer using Microsoft System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: This process is similar to refreshing a computer, but since you are replacing the machine, you have to run the backup job separately from the deployment of Windows 10.
segment.target: This process is similar to refreshing a computer, but since you are replacing the machine, you have to run the backup job separately from the deployment of Windows 10.

segment.source: For the purposes of this topic, we will use three machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0004.
segment.target: For the purposes of this topic, we will use three machines: DC01, CM01, and PC0004.

segment.source: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.
segment.target: DC01 is a domain controller and CM01 is a machine running Windows Server 2012 R2 Standard.

segment.source: PC0004 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1 that will be replaced with a new machine running Windows 10.
segment.target: PC0004 is a machine with Windows 7 SP1 that will be replaced with a new machine running Windows 10.

segment.source: DC01, CM01, and PC0004 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.
segment.target: DC01, CM01, and PC0004 are all members of the domain contoso.com for the fictitious Contoso Corporation.

segment.source: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more details on the setup for this topic, please see Deploy Windows 10 with the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: In this topic, you will create a backup-only task sequence that you run on PC0004, the machine you are replacing.
segment.target: In this topic, you will create a backup-only task sequence that you run on PC0004, the machine you are replacing.

segment.source: For more information, see Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer.
segment.target: For more information, see Replace a Windows 7 computer with a Windows 10 computer.

segment.source: Create a replace task sequence
segment.target: Create a replace task sequence

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Operating Systems, right-click Task Sequences, and select Create MDT Task Sequence.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager Console, in the Software Library workspace, expand Operating Systems, right-click Task Sequences, and select Create MDT Task Sequence.

segment.source: On the Choose Template page, select the Client Replace Task Sequence template and click Next.
segment.target: On the Choose Template page, select the Client Replace Task Sequence template and click Next.

segment.source: On the General page, assign the following settings and click Next:
segment.target: On the General page, assign the following settings and click Next:

segment.source: Task sequence name: Replace Task Sequence
segment.target: Task sequence name: Replace Task Sequence

segment.source: Task sequence comments: USMT backup only
segment.target: Task sequence comments: USMT backup only

segment.source: On the Boot Image page, browse and select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image package.
segment.target: On the Boot Image page, browse and select the Zero Touch WinPE x64 boot image package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the MDT Package page, browse and select the OSD / MDT 2013 package.
segment.target: On the MDT Package page, browse and select the OSD / MDT 2013 package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the USMT Package page, browse and select the OSD / Microsoft Corporation User State Migration Tool for Windows 8 10.0.10240.16384 package.
segment.target: On the USMT Package page, browse and select the OSD / Microsoft Corporation User State Migration Tool for Windows 8 10.0.10240.16384 package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the Settings Package page, browse and select the OSD / Windows 10 x64 Settings package.
segment.target: On the Settings Package page, browse and select the OSD / Windows 10 x64 Settings package.

segment.source: Then click Next.
segment.target: Then click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page, review the details and then click Next.
segment.target: On the Summary page, review the details and then click Next.

segment.source: On the Confirmation page, click Finish.
segment.target: On the Confirmation page, click Finish.

segment.source: Review the Replace Task Sequence.
segment.target: Review the Replace Task Sequence.

segment.source: Note: This task sequence has many fewer actions than the normal client task sequence.
segment.target: Note: This task sequence has many fewer actions than the normal client task sequence.

segment.source: If it doesn't seem different, make sure you selected the Client Replace Task Sequence template when creating the task sequence.
segment.target: If it doesn't seem different, make sure you selected the Client Replace Task Sequence template when creating the task sequence.

segment.source: figure 34
segment.target: figure 34

segment.source: Figure 34.
segment.target: Figure 34.

segment.source: The backup-only task sequence (named Replace Task Sequence).
segment.target: The backup-only task sequence (named Replace Task Sequence).

segment.source: Associate the new machine with the old computer
segment.target: Associate the new machine with the old computer

segment.source: This section walks you through the process of associating a blank machine, PC0006, with an old machine, PC0004, for the purpose of replacing PC0004 with PC0006.
segment.target: This section walks you through the process of associating a blank machine, PC0006, with an old machine, PC0004, for the purpose of replacing PC0004 with PC0006.

segment.source: PC0006 can be either a physical or virtual machine.
segment.target: PC0006 can be either a physical or virtual machine.

segment.source: Make a note of the PC0006 machine's MAC Address.
segment.target: Make a note of the PC0006 machine's MAC Address.

segment.source: (If PC0006 is a virtual machine, you can see the MAC Address in the virtual machine settings.) In our example, the PC0006 MAC Address is 00:15:5D:0A:6A:96.
segment.target: (If PC0006 is a virtual machine, you can see the MAC Address in the virtual machine settings.) In our example, the PC0006 MAC Address is 00:15:5D:0A:6A:96.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Devices, and then select Import Computer Information.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Devices, and then select Import Computer Information.

segment.source: On the Select Source page, select Import single computer and click Next.
segment.target: On the Select Source page, select Import single computer and click Next.

segment.source: On the Single Computer page, use the following settings and then click Next:
segment.target: On the Single Computer page, use the following settings and then click Next:

segment.source: Computer Name: PC0006
segment.target: Computer Name: PC0006

segment.source: MAC Address: the mac address from step 1
segment.target: MAC Address: the mac address from step 1

segment.source: Source Computer: PC0004
segment.target: Source Computer: PC0004

segment.source: figure 35
segment.target: figure 35

segment.source: Figure 35.
segment.target: Figure 35.

segment.source: Creating the computer association between PC0004 and PC0006.
segment.target: Creating the computer association between PC0004 and PC0006.

segment.source: On the User Accounts page, select Capture and restore all user accounts and click Next.
segment.target: On the User Accounts page, select Capture and restore all user accounts and click Next.

segment.source: On the Data Preview page, click Next.
segment.target: On the Data Preview page, click Next.

segment.source: On the Choose Target Collection page, select the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection and click Next.
segment.target: On the Choose Target Collection page, select the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection and click Next.

segment.source: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.
segment.target: On the Summary page, click Next, and then click Close.

segment.source: Select the User State Migration node and review the computer association in the right pane.
segment.target: Select the User State Migration node and review the computer association in the right pane.

segment.source: Right-click the PC0004/PC0006 association and select View Recovery Information.
segment.target: Right-click the PC0004/PC0006 association and select View Recovery Information.

segment.source: Note that a recovery key has been assigned already, but a user state store location has not.
segment.target: Note that a recovery key has been assigned already, but a user state store location has not.

segment.source: Review the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection.
segment.target: Review the Install Windows 10 Enterprise x64 collection.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see the PC0006 machine in the collection.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see the PC0006 machine in the collection.

segment.source: You might have to update and refresh the collection again.
segment.target: You might have to update and refresh the collection again.

segment.source: Create a device collection and add the PC0004 computer
segment.target: Create a device collection and add the PC0004 computer

segment.source: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.
segment.target: On CM01, using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, right-click Device Collections, and then select Create Device Collection.

segment.source: Use the following settings.
segment.target: Use the following settings.

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.source: Name: USMT Backup (Replace)
segment.target: Name: USMT Backup (Replace)

segment.source: Limited Collection: All Systems
segment.target: Limited Collection: All Systems

segment.source: Membership rules:
segment.target: Membership rules:

segment.source: Direct rule
segment.target: Direct rule

segment.source: Resource Class: System Resource
segment.target: Resource Class: System Resource

segment.source: Attribute Name: Name
segment.target: Attribute Name: Name

segment.source: Value: PC0004
segment.target: Value: PC0004

segment.source: Select Resources
segment.target: Select Resources

segment.source: Select PC0004
segment.target: Select PC0004

segment.source: Review the USMT Backup (Replace) collection.
segment.target: Review the USMT Backup (Replace) collection.

segment.source: Do not continue until you see the PC0004 machine in the collection.
segment.target: Do not continue until you see the PC0004 machine in the collection.

segment.source: Create a new deployment
segment.target: Create a new deployment

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, select Task Sequences, right-click Replace Task Sequence, and then select Deploy.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Software Library workspace, select Task Sequences, right-click Replace Task Sequence, and then select Deploy.

segment.source: Use the following settings:
segment.target: Use the following settings:

segment.source: General
segment.target: General

segment.source: Collection: USMT Backup (Replace)
segment.target: Collection: USMT Backup (Replace)

segment.source: Deployment Settings
segment.target: Deployment Settings

segment.source: Purpose: Available
segment.target: Purpose: Available

segment.source: Make available to the following: Only Configuration Manager Clients
segment.target: Make available to the following: Only Configuration Manager Clients

segment.source: Scheduling
segment.target: Scheduling

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: User Experience
segment.target: User Experience

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Alerts
segment.target: Alerts

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Distribution Points
segment.target: Distribution Points

segment.source: default
segment.target: default

segment.source: Verify the backup
segment.target: Verify the backup

segment.source: This section assumes that you have a machine named PC0004 with the Configuration Manager 2012 client installed.
segment.target: This section assumes that you have a machine named PC0004 with the Configuration Manager 2012 client installed.

segment.source: Start the PC0004 machine, and using the Control Panel, start the Configuration Manager applet.
segment.target: Start the PC0004 machine, and using the Control Panel, start the Configuration Manager applet.

segment.source: In the Actions tab, select the Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, select Run Now, and click OK.
segment.target: In the Actions tab, select the Machine Policy Retrieval & Evaluation Cycle, select Run Now, and click OK.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: You also can use the Client Notification option in the Configuration Manager console, as shown in Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager.
segment.target: You also can use the Client Notification option in the Configuration Manager console, as shown in Refresh a Windows 7 SP1 client with Windows 10 using Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Using the Software Center, select the Replace Task Sequence deployment and click INSTALL.
segment.target: Using the Software Center, select the Replace Task Sequence deployment and click INSTALL.

segment.source: In the Software Center dialog box, click INSTALL OPERATING SYSTEM.
segment.target: In the Software Center dialog box, click INSTALL OPERATING SYSTEM.

segment.source: Allow the Replace Task Sequence to complete.
segment.target: Allow the Replace Task Sequence to complete.

segment.source: It should only take about five minutes.
segment.target: It should only take about five minutes.

segment.source: On CM01, in the D:MigData folder, verify that a folder was created containing the USMT backup.
segment.target: On CM01, in the D:MigData folder, verify that a folder was created containing the USMT backup.

segment.source: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, select the User State Migration node, right-click the PC0004/PC0006 association, and select View Recovery Information.
segment.target: Using the Configuration Manager console, in the Asset and Compliance workspace, select the User State Migration node, right-click the PC0004/PC0006 association, and select View Recovery Information.

segment.source: Note that the object now also has a user state store location.
segment.target: Note that the object now also has a user state store location.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: It may take a few minutes for the user state store location to be populated.
segment.target: It may take a few minutes for the user state store location to be populated.

segment.source: Deploy the new computer
segment.target: Deploy the new computer

segment.source: Start the PC0006 virtual machine, press F12 to Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot when prompted.
segment.target: Start the PC0006 virtual machine, press F12 to Pre-Boot Execution Environment (PXE) boot when prompted.

segment.source: Allow it to boot Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), and then complete the deployment wizard using the following settings:
segment.target: Allow it to boot Windows Preinstallation Environment (Windows PE), and then complete the deployment wizard using the following settings:

segment.source: Password: P@ssw0rd
segment.target: Password: P@ssw0rd

segment.source: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Custom Image
segment.target: Select a task sequence to execute on this computer: Windows 10 Enterprise x64 Custom Image

segment.source: The setup now starts and does the following:
segment.target: The setup now starts and does the following:

segment.source: Installs the Windows 10 operating system
segment.target: Installs the Windows 10 operating system

segment.source: Installs the Configuration Manager client
segment.target: Installs the Configuration Manager client

segment.source: Joins it to the domain
segment.target: Joins it to the domain

segment.source: Installs the applications
segment.target: Installs the applications

segment.source: Restores the PC0004 backup
segment.target: Restores the PC0004 backup

segment.source: When the process is complete, you will have a new Windows 10 machine in your domain with user data and settings restored.
segment.target: When the process is complete, you will have a new Windows 10 machine in your domain with user data and settings restored.
